document_data.name: Sarturl's Study of Magical Fields
document_data.author: [[Sarturl]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Sarturl's Study of Magical Fields''''' was an academic [[magic]] textbook written by the [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Sarturl]].
document_data.Contents: The book contained meticulously complete examinations and comparisons of magical effects that took up a physical volume of space. It was exhaustively detailed and precise, but Sarturl did not craft engaging prose and the book was terrifically dry to read. As an example of the depth of knowledge that Sarturl provided, an entire page was devoted to describing the smell of an active ''[[antimagic field]]''.
document_data.History: ''Sarturl's Study of Magical Fields'' was considered a classic and foundational piece of academia by the arcanists of [[Netheril]] during the Age of Discovery ({{yearlinkConvert|2654|NY}} onwards). Any respectable arcane library would be expected to contain a copy of it, along with other works such as ''[[Ivrynxra's Exploration of Enchantments]]'', ''[[Haerro's Veltanabula]]'', ''[[Oloam's on Serpentine Matters]]'', and ''[[Skouloond's Spell Studies]]''.
